Certainly! Here's a short story based on your prompt:

Virgil Sanders sat curled up on the couch with a stuffed animal clutched tightly to his chest. He couldn't quite explain why he was feeling so anxious and overwhelmed lately, but he knew that he needed to escape from his worries for a little while.

That's when Roman Sanders, his roommate and closest friend, walked into the living room. He immediately noticed Virgil's distressed state and knew exactly what to do.

"Hey, little one," Roman said gently, using the nickname he'd given Virgil when they first started exploring age regression together. "Do you need some help?"

Virgil nodded, and Roman sat down beside him on the couch. He gently took the stuffed animal from Virgil's arms and handed him a pacifier, which Virgil gratefully accepted.

"Let's get you into some comfortable clothes," Roman said, standing up and holding out his hand to help Virgil up from the couch. "And then we can watch a movie or something, okay?"

Virgil nodded again, feeling safe and comforted by Roman's caring presence. He let Roman guide him to his bedroom and help him change into a soft onesie with cartoon characters printed on it.

As they settled in on the couch with blankets and pillows, Roman put on a movie that he knew Virgil would enjoy. He wrapped his arm around Virgil's shoulders, holding him close as they watched the story unfold on the screen.

For the next hour, Virgil let himself slip further and further into his regressed state. He sucked on his pacifier and cuddled up against Roman, feeling a sense of security and peace that he hadn't experienced in weeks.

When the movie ended, Roman looked down at Virgil and saw that he had fallen asleep. He smiled softly and gently picked Virgil up, carrying him to his bed and tucking him in.

"Sleep tight, little one," Roman whispered, brushing a strand of hair away from Virgil's face. "I'm here for you, always."

As Virgil slept peacefully, Roman stayed by his side, watching over him and making sure that he was safe and comfortable. He knew that age regression wasn't a cure-all for Virgil's anxiety, but it was a way for him to find some relief and escape from his worries for a little while.

And with Roman as his caregiver, Virgil knew that he would always have someone to turn to when he needed help.
